title: What does the winner of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions get?
text:
Who will the judges choose as their winner? (Picture: Syco/ITV)

Britain’s Got Talent returns tomorrow (31 August) but with a new format that will see champions from previous years battle it out for the ultimate title.

Viewers will once again be treated to the talents of Paul Potts, the first-ever winner, Boogie Storm, The Sacred Riana (the most watched act to date), Bad Salsa, The Nelson Twins and many more.

Connie Talbot, 18, who was just six years old when she performed Somewhere Over The Rainbow, will also be back – but with an original song this time.

The show will run for six weeks, and each week the judging panel, comprised of Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams, will choose one act that they would like to see in the final.

But the public has power too, and will be able to choose a second act.

What does the winner of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions get?

So, the crème de la crème of Britain’s Got Talent have returned, but what will they walk away with if they win?

Originally, the winners of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions were set to receive £50,000, but that quickly changed when Simon Cowell discovered the sum of money up for grabs.

The music mogul, 59, apparently offered to double the prize money for the returning contestants, boosting the prize fund from £50,000 to a very generous £100,000 during the recording of the first show.

Reports suggested that Simon overheard host Ant McPartlin talking about the prize money before suddenly interjecting: ‘Did you just say fifty grand? That’s it?’

According to reports, Ant replied: ‘That’s it. Unless you want to double it. Do you want to double it?’

The live audience cheered, prompting Simon to spontaneously respond: ‘Yes, I will. It’s a hundred grand everybody,’ prompting rapturous applause from the crowd.

The doubling of the prize money will come as welcome news to Australian act The Nelson Twins who had originally joked that the £50k prize money would only just about cover their costs for appearing on the show after they had, ‘blown their life savings on a sandwich in Covent Garden.’

That’s a feeling we can all relate to right there.

When is the final of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions?

The Nelson Brothers are back (Picture: Syco/Thames)

The official date for the final is yet to be confirmed, but it is expected to take place on Saturday 5 October.

However, we do know that it won’t be shown live. The show was filmed earlier this year and the winner has already been chosen.

There are rumours as to who took home the trophy, but let’s not spoil the fun.

Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions will air tomorrow at 8pm.
